meanings.definition: A photograph taken quickly and informally.
meanings.sent1: I took a snapshot of my friends at the park.
meanings.sent2: She keeps a collection of family snapshots in her album.
meanings.sent3: The snapshot of the cat wearing sunglasses made me laugh.
meanings.sent4: His words painted a snapshot of the bustling city in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The snapshot captured the joy of the children playing in the yard.

meanings.sent1: Let me give you a quick snapshot of the main points.
meanings.sent2: The report provides a snapshot of the current market trends.
meanings.sent3: His snapshot of the movie plot left out all the exciting parts.
meanings.sent4: Her description was a snapshot of the entire situation.
meanings.sent5: The snapshot of the story highlighted the key events.

meanings.sent1: The sudden snapshot of the mountain took my breath away.
meanings.sent2: The snapshot of the sunset was stunning.
meanings.sent3: His snapshot of the situation was completely wrong.
meanings.sent4: The snapshot of her talent left everyone amazed.
meanings.sent5: The snapshot of the city skyline was unforgettable.
